title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 for the Patriots from 1994-2005, originating from a USC tradition started by Junior Seau.
Junior Seau requested McGinest's blessing to wear No. 55 when joining the Patriots, highlighting mutual respect and tradition.
The No. 55 jersey became iconic with players like McGinest, Seau, and Brandon Spikes contributing to its legacy in New England.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County recorded the highest snowfall during the recent storm, with Salisbury and Beverly receiving 13 inches.
Northeastern Massachusetts experienced the most significant snow accumulations, according to reports from snow observers and the National Weather Service.
Various towns in Franklin and Middlesex counties reported lower snow totals, generally ranging from 0.5 to 7 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC during the Patriots vs Seahawks game in Santa Clara.
After the Super Bowl, Tirico will host NBC's Olympic studio program from Levi's Stadium.
Tirico emphasizes preparation and enjoyment, balancing multiple roles during the Super Bowl and Olympic coverage.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara.
This is the Patriots' 12th Super Bowl appearance, holding the NFL record, and the Seahawks' fourth, with a 1-2 record.
Drake Maye could become the youngest quarterback to win a Super Bowl; the Patriots have a 41.4% blitz rate this postseason.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel sought advice from Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of coaching his first Super Bowl.
Vrabel employed a halftime simulation strategy using Bad Bunny's music, similar to tactics used by Belichick and Reid.
In his first year, Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season, winning Coach of the Year before the Super Bowl.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots can set an NFL record for most Super Bowl wins by a franchise with a victory over the Seahawks.
A win would make Mike Vrabel the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.
Quarterback Drake Maye could become the first second-year QB to win a Super Bowl since Russell Wilson in 2014.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims for a Super Bowl LX win to strengthen his Hall of Fame case with the Patriots.
Diggs, 32, seeks his first Super Bowl victory and possibly an MVP award to enhance his career accolades.
Despite achievements, Diggs may face challenges entering the Hall of Fame, ranking below peers in Pro Football Reference scores.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, former Patriots and Colts kicker, was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame class of 2026.
Vinatieri scored 2,673 points, the most in NFL history, with 21 seasons scoring over 100 points and 44 consecutive field goals.
He won three Super Bowls with the Patriots and played key roles in their victories, including historic clutch performances.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel simulated a longer halftime break during final Super Bowl practice at Stanford Stadium.
Rapper Bad Bunny will perform at the halftime show; rumors suggest Cardi B might join as a guest performer.
Quarterback Drake Maye fully participated in practice; Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited due to injuries.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: The Super Bowl will feature quarterbacks Drake Maye of the Patriots and Sam Darnold of the Seahawks.
Both quarterbacks were former No. 3 overall picks and face pressure to minimize turnovers against strong defenses.
The Patriots' defense, led by Milton Williams, will be key in challenging Seattle's potent offense led by Jaxon Smith-Njigba.
